---
title: "Restricted EM Derivation"
---

Given our $\alpha$-SG($\Sigma$) vector $X = \sqrt W G$, with underlying latent stable subordinator W, and Gaussian vector G, note that $X|W=w \sim N(0,w\Sigma)$ we can write our complete data likelihood function as:

$$
\begin{aligned}
\mathcal L_c(\Theta) &\equiv f(\Theta | \textbf x, w) \\
& = f_{X|w}(\Theta, \textbf x|w)f_W(\Theta)
\end{aligned}
$$

Where $\Theta = (\theta, \alpha)^\text T$, $\theta = (\mu, \Sigma)$.
So the log likelihood for the observed data is:

$$
\begin{aligned}
\ell_c(\Theta|\textbf x, w) &= \sum_{i=1}^N \log f_{X|w}(\Theta, x_i|w) + \sum_{i=1}^N \log f_W(\Theta, w_i, )
\end{aligned}
$$
